profile.text: Abd al Rahim al Nashiri is an alleged USS Cole bomber who was held as a captive at Guantánamo Bay^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. He was interrogated in Thailand, reportedly under the oversight of Gina Haspel^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: Ali Soufan is a former FBI agent^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262] who conducted interrogations at Guantánamo Bay and elsewhere before and after the September 11 attacks^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Soufan stated that during his time at Guantánamo Bay, the CIA's chief of base was a man who was helpful and a good team player^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Soufan does not recall seeing Gina Haspel in Guantánamo Bay, but suggests it is possible she visited Guantánamo while she was chief of base in the black site where Abd al Rahim al Nashiri was held^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: Donald Trump is the former President of the United States. During his administration, Venezuelan migrants were sent to the U.S. military base in Guantánamo Bay, Cuba. The Trump administration portrayed these detainees as being in the custody of Immigration and Customs Enforcement, though military guards and medics were handling them. The Trump administration has also not released the migrants' names. President Donald Trump has called the would-be deportees 'criminal aliens,' and administration officials have portrayed them as associates of the Tren de Aragua gang. On Jan. 29, Trump ordered the military and homeland security to prepare to expand a migrant operations center at Guantánamo Bay 'for high-priority criminal aliens unlawfully present in the United States.' A group of legal aid organizations sued the Trump administration, asking that migrants who had been taken to Guantánamo Bay be given access to lawyers to see if they want legal representation to challenge their detention there. It is not clear what legal authority the Trump administration has to hold people arrested in the United States at Guantánamo for immigration detention purposes.

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: Gail Helt is a former CIA analyst^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262] and currently a professor of Security and Intelligence Studies at King University in Tennessee^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. She stated that there has been "a lot of shadiness" with the way the CIA has spoken about Gina Haspel's agency career^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. When asked about Haspel potentially serving at Guantánamo Bay, she said she had no personal knowledge of that and couldn't discuss it if she did, but it wouldn't surprise her^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text:
Gina Haspel is a former CIA Director^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. An attorney, Rita Radostitz, for Khalid Sheik Mohammed claimed in a secret session at Guantánamo Bay in November 2018 that Haspel ran a secret CIA outpost at Guantánamo, seemingly referring to a post-9/11 black site^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. This claim appears in a partially redacted transcript of the hearing^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Defense lawyers argued that Haspel's alleged role at the prison would preclude a fair trial for the accused 9/11 orchestrators^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

Haspel reportedly ran a CIA black site in Thailand where two terror suspects were waterboarded, possibly before she arrived there^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. The statement that she had a similar assignment at the Guantánamo Bay terror-detention center would reveal a never-before disclosed chapter of her clandestine career^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

Radostitz argued that restrictions on defense attorneys asking questions about Haspel’s overseas black site service hampered their ability to prepare to defend Mohammed^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

A 2014 Senate study said the CIA had two secret prisons at Guantánamo in 2003 and 2004^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

John Kiriakou, a former CIA counterterrorism officer, said he was offered the Guantánamo chief of base position in late 2002 or early 2003 but declined^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. He suggested Haspel could have been there for a short period of time^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

Gail Helt, a former CIA analyst, noted the 'shadiness' surrounding the agency's statements about Haspel's career and the CIA won't disclose 30 short-term, temporary duty assignments she held^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

Glenn Carle, a former CIA officer, stated that it is plausible Haspel could have been chief of base at Guantánamo^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

Ali Soufan, a former FBI agent, stated he was not aware that she was at Guantánamo^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: Glenn Carle is a former career CIA officer^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262] who was sworn in on the same day as Gina Haspel in 1985^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. He left the agency in 2007^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Carle rejected the rendition and enhanced interrogation program as *illegal, unnecessary, and immoral*^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. He stated that it is certainly possible that Gina Haspel could have been chief of base at Guantánamo Bay^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: John Kiriakou is a former CIA counterterrorism officer^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. He told McClatchy that he was offered the Guantánamo chief of base position in late 2002 or early 2003, but he declined the offer^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Kiriakou stated that 'nobody wanted the job'^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. He also said that the CIA resorted to sending people on temporary duty assignments ranging from six weeks to nine months^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Kiriakou believes that Gina Haspel could have been at Guantanamo for a short period of time, describing a Gitmo stint as essentially a ticket punch for some agents associated with the black site program^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: Keith Parrella is a Marine Colonel and trial judge^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. In December, he rejected a motion by defense lawyers to dismiss charges or not make the trial death-penalty eligible^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. The defense argued that Gina Haspel's role as the top CIA official with control of top-secret classifications compromised the fairness of the trial^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. The case involves five men accused of conspiring in the September 11, 2001 attacks^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: Khalid Sheik Mohammed is the accused architect of the Sept. 11 attacks^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. He is among five men charged in a death-penalty case alleging their conspiracy in the Sept. 11, 2001 hijackings that killed 2,976 people^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Mohammed declared that he oversaw the 9/11 attacks “from A to Z” after three and a half years in CIA detention, including 183 rounds of waterboarding^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. He was held for years in covert CIA prisons^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Defense lawyers have been trying to explore what happened to captives at Guantánamo in their continuing bid to argue the case is compromised by the CIA years^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. No trial date has been set as lawyers litigate what evidence the defense teams can see^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: Lee Gelernt is an American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) immigrant rights lawyer. He is mentioned in the context of the Trump administration's decision to send Venezuelan migrants to Guantánamo Bay, Cuba. Gelernt stated that this action is the first time the government has sent people from U.S. soil to an overseas camp, raising potential legal issues. He is the lead counsel in a lawsuit filed by legal aid organizations against the Trump administration, seeking to provide migrants at Guantánamo Bay with access to legal representation to challenge their detention. The lawsuit also includes relatives of three detainees who have lost contact with the men. The lawsuit argues that the government cannot deny detainees their right to access counsel by detaining them at Guantánamo Bay.

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: Luis Alberto Castillo Rivera is a Venezuelan migrant who was detained in the U.S. and subsequently transferred to the U.S. military base in Guantánamo Bay, Cuba. He is one of the 53 men being held in Camp 6, a prison building at Guantánamo Bay. His relatives identified him from pictures released during the government transfer operations. He is a plaintiff in a lawsuit against the Trump administration, seeking access to legal representation to challenge his detention at Guantánamo Bay. The lawsuit was filed by legal aid organizations and includes relatives of detainees who have lost contact with the men and are worried about them.

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: Ramzi bin al Shibh is a 9/11 defendant who was held at Guantánamo Bay^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. He was held at Guantánamo *earlier* than September 2006^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262], when the CIA sent alleged 9/11 conspirators and other "high-value detainees" to military detention there after holding them in secret spy agency custody for three or four years^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: Rita Radostitz is a lawyer representing Khalid Sheik Mohammed, the accused architect of the Sept. 11 attacks^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. She argued in a secret hearing at Guantánamo Bay on Nov. 16 that CIA Director Gina Haspel ran a secret agency outpost at Guantánamo^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. This claim appears in a partially redacted transcript of the hearing^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Radostitz argued that Haspel’s alleged role at the prison precludes a fair trial for the men accused of orchestrating the 9/11 attacks^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. She was arguing for dismissal of the charges, or to not make the trial death-penalty eligible, because of Haspel’s role as the top CIA official with control of top secret classifications^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Radostitz also argued that restrictions on defense attorneys asking questions about Haspel’s overseas black site service hamstrung their ability to prepare to defend Mohammed^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Radostitz stated that prosecutors are unwilling to talk about the names of the people involved in the torture^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. She also noted that it makes it impossible for people at Guantánamo, who may have seen Haspel when she was there as chief of base, to identify her and talk about it^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Radostitz said that restrictions imposed on defense attorneys with access to classified information prohibit her from elaborating or commenting on what was said in a closed session^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: Tilso Ramon Gomez Lugo is a Venezuelan migrant who was detained by the Trump administration and sent to the U.S. military base in Guantánamo Bay, Cuba. He is one of 53 men being held in Camp 6, a prison building previously used to house al-Qaida suspects. His relatives identified him from pictures released during the government transfer operations. He is a plaintiff in a lawsuit filed by legal aid organizations against the Trump administration, seeking access to legal representation for migrants detained at Guantánamo Bay.

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: Tricia McLaughlin is a spokesperson for the Department of Homeland Security. On Wednesday, she stated that the agency had sent nearly 100 people to Guantánamo Bay, all with final deportation orders. She said these individuals were considered to have "committed a crime by entering the United States illegally" and included "violent gang members and other high-threat illegal aliens." She also mentioned that the Coast Guard, part of the Department of Homeland Security, was guarding 45 migrants in a lower-security building on the other side of the base as of Tuesday.

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards
